title: Much, Many, A Lot, A Lot Of

questions.question: How ............................ brothers and sisters do you have?
questions.description: Use many with plural nouns in questions and negatives.

questions.question: She doesn't have .............................. money.
questions.description: Either much or a lot of is possible here.

questions.question: He did ............................. for me when he was alive.
questions.description: Much is not normally used in affirmative sentences.

questions.question: She has ................................. friends.
questions.description: Many is not normally used in affirmative sentences.

questions.question: There aren't .............................. apples on the tree.
questions.description: Either many or a lot of is possible here.  A lot of can be used in affirmative, negative and interrogative sentences.

questions.question: I have been watching ............................... movies recently.
questions.description: Many is not normally used in affirmative sentences. Either lots of or a lot of can be used here.

questions.question: I ate ................................ food.
questions.description: A lot cannot be used before a noun. Use a lot of.

questions.question: ....................................... social problems are caused by poverty.
I didn't know ................................ people at the party.
I have been partying ............................... these days.
questions.description: A lot of is used before a noun.
